item.item: The native identifier represents the primary key of an object, all objects which are persistent must have this property.
The class represents the object class name, this string is used to instantiate the correct object once loaded from a container.
The type is used as an element of an object to qualify or provide its type.
The geometry is used as an element of an object to define its geometric shape.
The namespace is used to disambiguate homonym identifiers.
The local identifier is used to provide a unique identifier within a specific namespace.
The persistent identifier represents an immutable global unique identifier.
The symbol represents an acronym by which an object can be publicly identified.
The valid identifier is a persistent identifier which is valid or official, as opposed to a persistent identifier which is invalid or obsolete.

The sequence number is a global unique identifier which is dynamically assigned, this identifier is serial, in that it is assigned at commit time and subsequently incremented. This value is an unsigned integer

The sequence number is a global unique identifier which is dynamically assigned, this identifier is serial, in that it is assigned at commit time and subsequently incremented. This value is a hexadecimal number prefixed by a hash.
The graph reference is the unique identifier of a graph element.
The domain indicates what an object is.
The authority identifies the entity responsible for the object and its information.
The collection represents the group to which an object belongs.
The identifier is used to disambiguate objects belonging to the same domain and collection.
Versions are used to identify iterations of the same object in time.
Synonyms are alternative ways of referring to an object, these may also be identifiers not formally defined in the current system.
The origin vertex of a directed graph relationship.
The reference to the origin vertex of a directed graph relationship in a graph.
The predicate of a directed graph relationship.
The destination vertex of a directed graph relationship.
The reference to the destination vertex of a directed graph relationship in a graph.
A reference to the master copy of the current object.
The data type of a property or value.
The data attributes of a property or value.
The type of a term object.
The type of a node object.
The type or scope of the session.
The type or scope of the transaction.
The label or short description of an object.
A definition provides detailed information regarding an object without reference of its context.
A description provides detailed information regarding an object in a specific context.
A collection of notes or comments.
A collection of examples or instances illustrating various uses of a property.
A label used to identify a structure in a list of structures.
This represents the number of tag objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of term objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of node objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of edge objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of unit objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of user objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of session objects featuring a specific property.
This represents the number of transaction objects featuring a specific property.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in tag objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in term objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in node objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in edge objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in unit objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in user objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in entity objects.
The list of paths or locations within a structure in which a specific property can be found in transaction objects.
This represents the list of tags featured as leaf offsets.
This represents the list of tags featured as leaf offsets and their relative offset paths.
This represents the list of object references and their relative collection.
This represents a reference to a container structure.
This represents the property reference which represents the index within a container structure.
This indicates the minimum featured value of a property.
This indicates the minimum allowed range value of a property.
This indicates the maximum featured value of a property.
This indicates the maximum allowed range value of a property.
This indicates the regular expression which validates a string.
This indicates the decimal places of a floating point number.
This indicates the geographic location and geometry of an object.
This indicates the displayed geographic location and geometry of an object.
The date and time in which the record was created.
The date and time in which the record was last modified.
The line number containing the column name or label.
The line number containing the column description or information.
The line number containing the column examples.
The line number containing the column symbol.
The line number at which data starts.
A list of value transformation actions.
The starting time of the session.
The ending time of the session.
The status or outcome of the session.
The files or resources associated with the session.
The starting time of the transaction.
The starting time of the transaction.
The status or outcome of the transaction.
The collection associated with the transaction.
The record associated with the transaction.
The field associated with the transaction.
The alias, symbol or variable name associated with the transaction.
The value associated with the transaction.
The message or log entry associated with the transaction.
The list of transaction operations and their outcome.
The first name of an entity.
The mailing address of an entity.
The electronic mail address of an entity.
The internet address of an entity.
The telephone number of an entity.
The telefax number of an entity.
A reference to the entity or entities to which the current object is affiliated.
The valid, current or preferred entity reference.
The PGP public key of the entity.
The PGP fingerprint of the entity.
The name of the icon or picture of the entity.
The list of roles a user or service covers in the hosting system.
The number of users for which the current user is a referrer.
The network connection protocol or scheme.
Network TCP or UDP port number.
